oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mapping out territories, circa 1951 December 07
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of Mrs. W.E. Park, Jr., chairman for East Nashville, and Mrs. Richard Marshall, outlying district chairman, of the Fannie Battle Carol Committee, seen consulting a map of Davidson County during a public relations visit to the Nashville Banner office, circa 7 December 1951. The various chairmen of this civic-minded group made a visit to the newspaper and met with columnist "Betty Banner" to arrange a series of features to acquaint the public with the annual Christmas project fundraiser for the Fannie Battle Day Home. This photograph illustrated the newspaper article "B. Banner Gets Christmas Spirit with Carol Committee," published in the 7 December 1951 issue of the Nashville Banner. Forms part of the Fannie Battle Day Home Records. 1 photograph : b & w ; 8.25 x 10 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Park, W.E., Mrs.; Marshall, Richard, Mrs.
Fannie Battle Day Home; Fannie Battle Social Workers; Nashville Banner
